html: Jehovah assures the Zion/Jerusalem category of his people that the adversity they endure is but for a small moment. He hears their cries as he heard their ancestors who were in bondage in Egypt (Exodus 3:7-9). As Moses and Hezekiah interceded with Jehovah on behalf of their peoples, so does his servant—their voice. Soon they will see Jehovah who will personally teach them: “Strengthen the hands grown feeble, steady the failing knees. Say to those with fearful hearts, ‘Take courage, be unafraid! See, your God is coming to avenge and to reward; God himself will come and deliver you’” (Isaiah 35:3-4).
